Description: Open-work ebony furniture-fitting(?) in the form of Bes; very flat with good detail on the front but much less on the back. There is a tenon in the top of the head for attachment and an additional tenon below each foot. Cracked vertically.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995 Feb-May, Atlanta, Emory University, Reflections of Women in the New Kingdom 1997 May-Oct, Museum of St.Albans, Ancient Egypt
Acquisition notes: Marked in ink 'Sams 1835', clearly an error for 'Salt 1835' as recorded on the Birch Slip.
